item.description:
The hike will be about 2 hours and will cover about 2.4 miles. Shenipsit State Forest (a.k.a. Soapstone Mt.), CT covers 6,126 acres in the towns of Ellington, Somers, and Stafford Springs. Hike from the trailhead at the parking lot on the east side of the mountain, up to near the peak via .7 mile on a paved road (Soapstone Rd., closed right now), then down a dirt road for .5 mile to the west (still Soapstone Rd.), back onto trail going east for about .5 mile up to the peak and the tower of Soapstone Mt. Then back down the road .7 mile to the parking area. The hike would be moderately difficult with a fair amount of up/down on the trail and upward road hiking at the start. The peak's view is nice to the North.

Meet at the parking lot on Gulf Rd. in somers at 9 AM. The hike will be over at about 11:00 AM.

The leader on this one in Kevin S (http://hiking.meetup.... ) so please direct questions to him.

Location/Directions via MapQuest for parking area (Soapstone Rd. just off of Gulf Rd.):
http://www.mapquest.c...

Trail Map at:
http://www.ct.gov/dep...

group.name: The Hartford Area Hikingâ„¢ Meetup Group

item.name: Hike at Soapstone Mtn. in Somers CT
